name: qsv-pivotp
description: Pivots CSV data using the Polars engine. The pivot operation consists of: - One or more index columns (these will be the new rows) - A column that will be pivoted (this will create the new columns) - A values column that will be aggregated - An aggregation function to apply. Features "smart" aggregation auto-selection. For examples, see https://github.com/dathere/qsv/blob/master/tests/test_pivotp.rs.

args.name: input
args.description: is the input CSV file. The file must have headers. If the file has a pschema.json file, it will be used to inform the pivot operation unless --infer-len is explicitly set to a value other than the default of 10,000 rows. Stdin is not supported.

args.name: on-cols
args.description: The column(s) to pivot on (creates new columns).

options.description: The aggregation function to use: first - First value encountered last - Last value encountered sum - Sum of values min - Minimum value max - Maximum value mean - Average value median - Median value len - Count of values item - Get single value from group. Raises error if there are multiple values. smart - use value column data type & statistics to pick an aggregation. Will only work if there is one value column, otherwise it falls back to `first` [default: smart]
The separator in generated column names in case of multiple --values columns. [default: _]
Use comma as decimal separator when READING the input. Note that you will need to specify an alternate --delimiter.
The field delimiter for reading/writing CSV data. Must be a single character. (default: ,)
Skip rows that can't be parsed.

The column(s) to use as the index (row labels). Specify multiple columns by separating them with a comma. The output will have one row for each unique combination of the index's values. If None, all remaining columns not specified on --on and --values will be used. At least one of --index and --values must be specified.
Number of rows to scan when inferring schema. Set to 0 to scan entire file. [default: 10000]
Maintain the order of the input columns.
Write output to <file> instead of stdout.
Do not return smart aggregation chosen nor pivot result shape to stderr.
Sort the transposed columns by name.
When set, will attempt to parse columns as dates.
Validate a pivot by checking the pivot column(s)' cardinality.

The column(s) containing values to aggregate. If an aggregation is specified, these are the values on which the aggregation will be computed. If None, all remaining columns not specified on --on and --index will be used. At least one of --index and --values must be specified.
